org.jvnet.inflector

Interface Rule

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRegexReplacementRule, CategoryInflectionRule, IrregularMappingRule, RegexReplacementRule, SuffixInflectionRule

    public interface Rule

    A Rule represents how a word changes from one form to another.

    Implementations of this interface must be safe for use by multiple concurrent threads in order to satisfy the contract of Pluralizer.

    Author:
    Tom White

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean applies(String word)
      Tests to see if this rule applies for the given word.
      String apply(String word)
      Applies this rule to the word, and transforming it into a new form.

    • Method Detail

      • applies

        boolean applies(String word)

        Tests to see if this rule applies for the given word.

        Parameters:
        word - the word that is being tested
        Returns:
        true if this rule should be applied, false otherwise

      • apply

        String apply(String word)

        Applies this rule to the word, and transforming it into a new form.

        Parameters:
        word - the word to apply this rule to
        Returns:
        the transformed word
